revised_title: Bergemoletto Snowfall Disaster: A Remarkable Account of Survival and Rescue
tldr: In 1755, a massive snowfall in Bergemoletto, Italy, buried 24 people under a 60-foot-high snow heap. A man named Joseph Rochia and his family survived by clearing snow from their roof and seeking shelter in a stable. After several days, they were discovered and rescued, highlighting the incredible strength and resilience of the human spirit in the face of natural disasters.
